glossentry.glossdef: The call controller encodes and decodes the Diameter Credit-Control-Request (CCR) or Credit-Control-Answer (CCA) messages.
Cap is the highest limit assigned to the device by the top-level group on its hierarchy resources.
Credit Control Answer is the message that is exchanged between various network elements.
Credit Control Failure Handling Attribute Value Pair deglosstermines the behavior of the credit control client is a failure scenario.
Credit Control Request table defines the various counter attributes that are unique for a counter and are not dependent on other elements.
CCR initial request is initiated for an idle transaction in the network.
Credit Control Update Request is initiated for active transactions in a network.
The Counter Definition table defines the counter attributes that are unique for one counter and is regardless of other elements, for instance, data transfer type index.
Charging Data Record is an organized collection of information about the chargeable telecommunication events.

The Charging and rating engine is responsible for selecting a charging service (from the set of defined charging services in the system) and to rate and charge the call according to the definition of the selected charging service.

ME produces charging data records (CDRs) to record the details of all transactions. NCC CNF leverages microservices from Nokia Data Refinery (DR) to provide the NCC CDR handling and mediation features, creating CDR files that can be retrieved by external systems using SFTP.
The charging function as defined by the 3GPP specifications.
Cost Information is an important element to manage cost across several activities that are involved in cost engineering.
Class of Service is a method of prioritizing traffic in a network. It is either defined in the custom data dictionary or its value is picked from the device context.

A Kubernetes cluster is a set of nodes for running containerized applications. At a minimum, a cluster contains a worker node and a master node. The master node is responsible for maintaining the desired state of the cluster, such as which applications are running and which container images they use. Worker nodes actually run the applications and workloads. A cluster has the ability to schedule and run containers across a group of machines. Kubernetes containers are not tied to individual machines. Rather, they are abstracted across the cluster.
The Containerized Network Function (CNF) is a virtual network function built and deployed with cloud native technologies.
Change of Authorization provides a architecture to change the attributes of an authentication, authorization and accounting (AAA) session after it is authenticated

Containers are a logical packaging mechanism in which applications are abstracted from the environment in which they run. Containers are more lightweight than VMs: they share the OS kernel, start much faster, and use a fraction of the memory compared to booting an entire OS.
Counters are the non-negative integers the value for which increases until they reach the maximum amount and then roll over to zero.

Circuit switching is a methodology of implementing a telecommunications network in which two network nodes establish a dedicated communication channel (circuit) through the network before the nodes communicate.

The CSAR is a compressed file package defined by OASIS TOSCA standard that includes a TOSCA template of a Network Service, and all the scripts or files that a VNF needs for the lifecycle time from creation to termination.
Charging Trigger Function is a network node that generates charging events based on network resource consumption by a subscriber.
